head.title: LIVING HERE | Houses Near Fly-Fishing; Hooking a Big One

hedline.hl1: LIVING HERE | Houses Near Fly-Fishing; Hooking a Big One

abstract.p: Dr Walton Reeves comments on his fractional-share cabin in Sylvie, NC, that is close to fly-fishing areas; photos and brief descriptions of similar properties available around country (M)

block.p: WHO -- Dr. Walton Reeves, 50, a physician from Atlanta, left, with a friend, Tom Maybank, 34 WHAT -- 1-bedroom house WHERE -- Sylva, N.C.

I've been a fisherman for 25 years and everyone in my immediate family owns waders. I even proposed to my wife in the middle of a trout stream in north Georgia. I own a home site here in the Balsam Mountain Preserve community, where my long-term plan is to build a retirement home. Until then I have a fractional share of a cabin that entitles me to eight weeks of use a year, which is about all my family can manage time-wise.
WHO -- Dr. Walton Reeves, 50, a physician from Atlanta, left, with a friend, Tom Maybank, 34 WHAT -- 1-bedroom house WHERE -- Sylva, N.C.

I've been a fisherman for 25 years and everyone in my immediate family owns waders. I even proposed to my wife in the middle of a trout stream in north Georgia. I own a home site here in the Balsam Mountain Preserve community, where my long-term plan is to build a retirement home. Until then I have a fractional share of a cabin that entitles me to eight weeks of use a year, which is about all my family can manage time-wise.

I think fly-fishing is like riding a bike: it's easy to pick up again. But in many ways it is also like golf. It takes a lot of work to be a really good fly-fisherman. Throughout this development there are creeks where you can catch 8- or 12-inch southern brook trout. But there is also access to some of the bigger rivers, and bigger fish, in western North Carolina, like the Tuckaseigee, which is less than 10 miles away, and the Nantahala River, less than an hour away, where I can go on float trips with my son. As the hatches start in late spring and through the summer all the trout fisherman come out. Though you can catch and keep the fish, I'm not one to do that unless I'm planning on eating it.

Of course, it's not all about fishing. There are a lot of old timber roads that have been converted to hiking trails, the golf course is halfway completed and an equestrian center should be open later this year. I'd imagine a lot of owners will bring their horses up here to escape the heat of the summer with them. I'll certainly be escaping the heat of Atlanta, where it's easily 15 to 20 degrees warmer.
As told to Amy Gunderson
Information on properties was supplied by the listing companies.
WHERE -- Mountain Home, Ark. WHAT -- 4-bedroom house with cabins HOW MUCH -- $2.1 million

This six-acre property has 680 feet of frontage on the White River, where it meets the Buffalo National River. The White River is well known for trout fishing. The house, which was built in 1981, is 1,700 square feet and has three bathrooms and a full basement. There are also a pine cabin, an A-frame cabin and a cedar bunkhouse on the property, all currently used as rental units. The house and the outbuildings are offered furnished. There is also a boat dock. Broker: Al Page, Exit AL Page Realty, (800) 424-6880; www.exitalpagerealty.net.
WHERE -- Durango, Colo. WHAT -- 3-bedroom house HOW MUCH -- $799,900

This house is on 1.2 acres on the Florida River, which has brown, rainbow and cutthroat trout. Built in the mid-1960s and updated within the last two years, the house is 3,014 square feet and has three bathrooms. It is adjacent to a trout pond and is bordered by more than 200 acres of Bureau of Land Management property. Agent: Joe Bob McGuire, the Wells Group, (970) 375-7000; www.anglingproperties.com.
WHERE -- St. Anthony, Idaho WHAT -- 7-bedroom house HOW MUCH -- $520,000

Built in 1999, this house is on 1.3 acres and has frontage on Henry's Fork of the Snake River. The house, which is more than 5,000 square feet, has four and a half bathrooms, a hot tub, a jetted tub in the master bathroom, four fireplaces and a formal dining room. There are a covered front deck and an open back deck overlooking the river. Most rooms have river or mountain views. St. Anthony is about 80 miles from Yellowstone National Park. Agent: Peter Young, Outback Realty, (208) 241-4319; www.peteryoungsells.com.
WHERE -- Dell, Mont. WHAT -- 7-bedroom house HOW MUCH -- $12 million

Three miles of Big Sheep Creek runs through this 1,270-acre working cattle ranch, which also has a two-acre, spring-fed lake. The lake and the creek are stocked with rainbow trout. The house, a log structure built in 1989, is 6,182 square feet and has two stone fireplaces, a finished basement and a barbecue on the patio. There are also a caretaker's home and a workshop on the property. The house is in southwestern Montana, about a half-hour from a paved landing strip. Agent: Doug Hart, Hall and Hall, (307) 645-3297; www.hallandhall.com.
WHERE -- Crumpler, N.C. WHAT -- 3-bedroom house HOW MUCH -- $449,000

This 2,000-square-foot house looks out over 140 feet of frontage on the South Fork of the New River. The river, which can be fly-fished for trout, is also known for its stock of smallmouth bass. The house is on three levels, with a bedroom on each level. There are two bathrooms, a hot tub on the wraparound deck, hardwood floors, a stone fireplace, vaulted ceilings and exposed beams in the living room. Crumpler is 120 miles north of Asheville in the Blue Ridge Mountains. Agent: Kim Leek, Active Realty, (800) 979-5556; www.activerealtync.com.
WHERE -- Roseburg, Ore. WHAT -- 4-bedroom house HOW MUCH -- $689,000

This house is on three acres on the North Umpqua River, known for steelhead fishing in the summer months. Its section of the river has rapids; the prime fishing area is to the east, where a 31-mile section of the river is limited to fly-fishing only. The house was built in 1952 and is 2,808 square feet with two bathrooms, a fireplace, a two-car detached garage and a back deck with multiple levels that overlooks the river. Roseburg is 70 miles south of Eugene, Ore. Agent: Diana Osgood, ReMax Professional Realty, (541) 673-3272; www.dianaosgood.com.
